mods.note: ' CONFIDENTIAL 13484 y 22nd October, 1949. Kef« p/282 y M *' D®*r Residency, please refer to your letter No.162/24/49 of the 23rd September concerning Muscat subjects killed in Hyderabad. 2 We have made one or two enquiries of this nature of the Government of India about Aden subjects in Hyderabad and of Hyderabad is a relatively efficient one and the Military Government according to available evidence has treated the Arab population fairly; but what success a request for information about events so far in the past would have, or what consideration would be given to any claim for compensation or recovery, we are not in a position to say. 3. In view of the fact that the Sultan of Muscat is visiting India shortly, we feel that the most suitable course would be for him to approach the Indian Government himself on this matter, and would therefore suggest that the Sultan might raise it with them when he is in Delhi. 4. A copy of this letter is being sent to the Eastern De partment of the Foreign office, and to the Commonwealth Relations Office. replies have been received in due course. The Administration Yours ever. HIGH COMMISSION The Persian Gulf Residency BAHRA IN

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from the Office of the High Commissioner for India, New Delhi, to the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain, dated 22 October 1949. The letter refers to the killing of Muscat subjects in Hyderabad and suggests that the Sultan of Muscat raise the matter with the Indian Government himself during his upcoming visit to India.Internal office notes are found on folio 2.
